title: Currencies, regular contributions, rebalancing: the simple 'steering' of a portfolio

choices.text: Your result can shift because of exchange rates

questions.explanation: A USD position can rise or fall in CAD terms due to exchange rates, even if the USD price doesn't move.

choices.text: Reduce the stress of 'the right moment' by investing regularly

questions.explanation: DCA is a behavioral strategy that smooths your entry over time.
Rebalancing maintains the intended risk level by bringing the split back to target.

choices.text: Direct new contributions to the lagging asset class

questions.explanation: Rebalancing through contributions avoids selling and reduces complexity.

questions.prompt: True/False: FX is only a cost, never a risk.
questions.explanation: FX is both a cost *and* a performance factor (exchange rate fluctuations).
